intro: Corymbium gramineum, commonly known as the grassy corymbium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, giving it a distinctive appearance. Corymbium gramineum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
